text.p: The questions on this page will help us figure out the dimension of the space of polynomials [mathjaxinline]\mathbb {P}[/mathjaxinline].

Recall that [mathjaxinline]\mathbb {P}_ n[/mathjaxinline] is the set of polynomials with real coefficients of degree at most [mathjaxinline]n[/mathjaxinline]. What is the dimension of [mathjaxinline]\mathbb {P}_4[/mathjaxinline]?

font.p: Recall that the list [mathjaxinline]\{ 1; t; t^2; t^3; t^4\}[/mathjaxinline] forms a basis of [mathjaxinline]\mathbb {P}_4[/mathjaxinline], so the dimension is 5.
